API Changes from 10.1.3 ADF Faces

This document is a work in progress. It is not complete and will continue to be updated.

  • Java
  • styleClass/inlineStyle Attributes
  • Components
    • A-F
    • G-N
    • M-R
    • S
    • T-Z

Java

ProcessScope

processScope has been renamed to pageFlowScope at the request of of other groups. For compatibility, however, there is still a deprecated getProcessScope() method and processScope EL variable. Developers should switch to the new getPageFlowScope() method pageFlowScope EL variable.

Table, Tree and TreeTable changes

  • 10.1.3: oracle.adf.view.faces.model.CollectionModel
  • Current:oracle.adf.view.rich.model.CollectionModel

  • Current:oracle.adf.view.rich.model.TreeModel

  • Current:oracle.adf.view.rich.model.ChildPropertyTreeModel

  • 10.1.3: oracle.adf.view.faces.model.SortableModel
  • Current:oracle.adf.view.rich.model.SortableModel

  • 10.1.3: oracle.adf.view.faces.model.ModelUtils
  • Current:oracle.adf.view.rich.model.ModelUtils

Class Name:

  • 10.1.3: oracle.adf.view.faces.model.CurrencySet
  • Current:oracle.adf.view.rich.model.RowKeySet

  • 10.1.3: oracle.adf.view.faces.model.RowKeySet
  • Current:oracle.adf.view.rich.model.RowKeySetImpl

  • Current:oracle.adf.view.rich.model.RowKeySetTreeImpl

Class Name:

  • 10.1.3: oracle.adf.view.faces.model.SortCriterion
  • Current:oracle.adf.view.rich.model.SortCriterion

styleClass/inlineStyle Attributes

In 10.1.3 the styleClass and inlineStyle attributes affected components in different ways. These attributes on some components affected the entire component, whereas in other components, they affected only a portion of the component.

In Fusion, the styleClass and inlineStyle will consistently apply to the entire component. i.e., it will be rendered on the root dom element. If your styleClass and inlineStyle attribute values affect your Fusion component differently than they affected your 10.1.3 component, this is the reason.

In some cases, we've added attributes to allow easy styling of portions of a component, like contentStyle for the form components which affects the content portion (<input>) of the form compoennt. When skinning is supported in Fusion, you will have a fine level of control over styling components in addition to using the styleClass and inlineStyle attributes.

Components

  • A-F
  • G-N
  • M-R
  • S
  • T-Z

breadCrumbs

Component Name:

  • 10.1.3: menuPath
  • Before JM5: navigationPath
  • JM5 onwards: breadCrumbs

column

Component Name:

  • 10.1.3: column
  • Current: column

Changed Attributes:

10.1.3 Current Notes
formatType align use "start", "center" and "end", respectively for "text", "icon" and "number".
headerNoWrap removed. not in blaf+
gridVisible removed. you can control the gridding on the entire table using the "horizontalGridVisible" and "verticalGridVisible" properties on the table.
bandingShade removed. you can control the banding on the entire table using the "columnBandingInterval" and "rowBandingInterval" properties on the table.
separateRows removed. not in blaf+

Additional Notes:

  • todo

commandMenuItem

Component Name:

  • 10.1.3: goMenuItem
  • Current: commandMenuItem

Additional Notes:

  • The goMenuItem component is obsolete because it has been merged into commandNavigationItem. Use commandNavigationItem instead.

commandNavigationItem

Component Name:

  • 10.1.3: commandMenuItem
  • Current: commandNavigationItem

Changed Attributes:

10.1.3 Current Notes
(n/a) destination The URI this component references when activated. This is an alternative to using an action.
(n/a) targetFrame The name of the target frame (when using destination).
type (removed) No longer applicable. BLAF+ does not specify any special behavior for "type". If you must filter based on type, use EL on the rendered attribute to determine whether or not a navigation item is visible.

Additional Notes:

  • There is still a commandMenuItem component, but it is different than the 10.1.3 commandMenuItem component! In the current release commandMenuItem is for use with the new components menu (formerly panelMenu) and panelMenuBar.
  • This component obsoletes goMenuItem.

goButton

Component Name:

  • 10.1.3: goButton
  • Current: goButton

Changed Attributes:

10.1.3 Current Notes
longDesc (n/a) Removed; this was simply ignored in 10.1.3.

goLink

Component Name:

  • 10.1.3: goLink
  • Current: goLink

Changed Attributes:

10.1.3 Current Notes
longDesc (n/a) Removed; this was only used when inside of a messages component, which is not a supported usage.

goMenuItem see: commandNavigationItem

group

Component Name:

  • 10.1.3: (n/a)
  • Current: group

Additional Notes:

  • The group component is an invisible control that aggregates semantically-related children. The children of the group will not be displayed unless the parent of the group has specific support for displaying the grouped children, e.g. the rich panelForm.

icon

Component Name:

  • 10.1.3: objectIcon
  • Current: icon

image

Component Name:

  • 10.1.3: objectImage
  • Before JM5: objectImage
  • JM5 onwards: image

Changed Attributes:

10.1.3 Current Notes
align (removed) Obsolete. This item represents deprecated attributes on the image tag. Use styleClass or inlineStyle attributes.
borderWidth (removed) Obsolete. This item represents deprecated attributes on the image tag. Use styleClass or inlineStyle attributes.
height (removed) Obsolete. Use styleClass or inlineStyle attributes.
width (removed) Obsolete. Use styleClass or inlineStyle attributes.

Additional Notes:

  • None

inputChoice see: inputComboboxListOfValues

inputColor

Component Name:

  • 10.1.3: selectInputColor
  • Before JM5: selectInputColor
  • JM5 onnwards: inputColor

Changed Attributes:

10.1.3 Current Notes
(n/a) contentStyle use contentStyle to set the style for the content part of the component. For example, if you want the input field to be 300 pixels wide, you can do this: contentStyle="width:300px". In 10.1.3, inlineStyle was the closest equivalent, but inlineStyle was rendered on both the label and the content. In Fusion, inlineStyle and styleClass are rendered on the root dom element.
tip (removed) use the new help facet - see below. To upgrade put an outputText in the new help facet and set the outputText's 'value' attribute to the old tip text.
valign (removed) we default this to look correct, so this attribute is not needed. You can use styleClass and skinning together to override the default vertical alignment of the label and contents.
(n/a) colorData If chooseId attribute is set, this attribute is ignored. Otherwise it is used to specify the colorData attribute of the popup chooseColor provided by the inputColor.
(n/a) customColorData If chooseId attribute is set, this attribute is ignored. Otherwise it is used to specify the customColorData attribute of the popup chooseColor provided by the inputColor.
(n/a) defaultColor If chooseId attribute is set, this attribute is ignored. Otherwise it is used to specify the defaultColor attribute of the popup chooseColor provided by the inputColor.
(n/a) width If chooseId attribute is set, this attribute is ignored. Otherwise it is used to specify the width attribute of the popup chooseColor provided by the inputColor.

Changed Facets:

10.1.3 Current Notes
(n/a) help information to help the user fill in a field

(n/a) help information to help the user fill in a field

inputText

Component Name:

  • 10.1.3: inputText
  • Current: inputText

Changed Attributes:

10.1.3 Current Notes
(n/a) contentStyle use contentStyle to set the style for the content part of the inputText component. For example, if you want the input field to be 300 pixels wide, you can do this: contentStyle="width:300px". In 10.1.3, inlineStyle was the closest equivalent, but inlineStyle was rendered on both the label and the content. In Fusion, inlineStyle and styleClass are rendered on the root dom element.
messageDescUrl (removed) see messaging framework documentation
messageTargetFrame (removed) see messaging framework documentation
styleClass styleClass

If in 10.1.3, styleClass and inlineStyle were rendered on the label and the <input>. In Fusion, these attributes are rendered on the root dom element.

If you used one of the following public style classes as the styleClass attribute value:

  • AFFieldText
  • AFFieldTextLTR
  • AFPhoneFieldText
  • AFPostalCodeFieldText
  • AFAddressFieldText
  • AFFieldNumber
then you will need to append 'Marker' to the end of the name.

For example styleClass="AFFieldNumber" is now styleClass="AFFieldNumberMarker". This will ensure that only the 'content' piece (and not the 'label' piece) of the inputText component will be styled as AFFieldNumber. You can still modify the public style definitions and it will be picked up by using the "Marker" style class because in our base skin implementation we map to the public style by doing this: af|inputText.AFFieldNumberMarker::content {-tr-rule-ref:selector(".AFFieldNumber")}. We recommend that you do not add style properties to the "Marker" style classes. They are used solely in the css descendant selector to point to the content pseudo-element.

tip (removed) use the new help facet - see below. To upgrade put an outputText in the new help facet and set the outputText's 'value' attribute to the old tip text.
valign (removed) we default this to look correct, so this attribute is not needed. You can use styleClass and skinning together to override the default vertical alignment of the label and contents.

Changed Facets:

10.1.3 Current Notes
(n/a) help information to help the user fill in a field

messages

Component Name:

  • 10.1.3: messages
  • Current: messages

Changed Attributes:

10.1.3 Current Notes
(n/a) inline Whether to render the message list inline with the page or in a popup window. Normally these messages are rendered in a pop up. If this attribute is set to true, the messages list will be rendered inline wherever this component is located in the page layout.

navigationLevel see: navigationPane

navigationPane

Component Name:

  • 10.1.3: menuBar, menuButtons, menuChoice, menuList, and menuTabs
  • Current: navigationPane

Changed Attributes:

10.1.3 Current Notes
disabled or (n/a) disabled Whether the component is disabled.
(n/a) hint How the navigational items are displayed. Options are:
  • bar
  • buttons
  • choice
  • list
  • tabs
listStyle or (n/a) styleClass The style of the list should be encompassed through skinning instead.
startDepth level
title or (n/a) title Text that describes the items. (This attribute is only applicable if the rendering hint supports it, e.g. "choice".)

Additional Notes:

  • This component consolidates the old menuBar, menuButtons, menuChoice, menuList, and menuTabs components into a single component, navigationPane.
  • Some container components will automatically apply a suggested rendering hint if a hard-coded value is not defined.
  • Valid children for this component are now only commandNavigationItem components--it encompasses functionality that used to be provided by goMenuItem and commandMenuItem.

objectIcon see: icon

objectImage see: image

objectMedia see: media

objectSeparator see: separator

objectSpacer see: spacer

outputLabel

Component Name:

  • 10.1.3: outputLabel
  • Current: outputLabel

Changed Attributes:

10.1.3 Current Notes
anchor (removed) Obsolete. This attribute was ignored in 10.1.3; it gathered this information from the 'for' attribute.
messageType (removed) Obsolete, use FacesMessage instead.
messageDescUrl (removed) Obsolete. No equivalent exists.
messageTargetFrame (removed) Obsolete. No equivalent exists.

panelPage

Component Name:

  • 10.1.3: panelPage
  • Current: pageTemplate

Additional Notes:

  • The panelPage component has been replaced with page templates insead. This is a more flexible solution because it allows you to remove undesired regions, add extra regions, and fine tune the appearance.
  • The rich client demo contains a page listing various page templates. You may download the demo page to see how they are being used and you can also download the source for the template definitions so you can fine tune it for your specific needs.

panelAccordion

Component Name:

  • 10.1.3: showOnePanel
  • Current: panelAccordion

panelBorderLayout

Component Name:

  • 10.1.3: panelBorder
  • Current: panelBorderLayout

panelBox

Component Name:

  • 10.1.3: panelBox
  • Current: panelBox

Changed Attributes:

10.1.3 Current Notes
width (removed) Obsolete, width can be set using inlineStyle.
(n/a) contentStyle this is the inline style for the content region only.

Additional Notes:

  • Not all of the backgrounds may be skinned properly for Tier 1.
  • The default width of the panelBox (which used to be 33%) has been removed. PanelBox will now grow with its content unless it is in a geometry managed component or the width in inlineStyle is set.

panelButtonBar

Component Name:

  • 10.1.3: panelButtonBar
  • Current: panelButtonBar does not exist in 11G. There is a scope enhancement request to create this component, but it is currently on the bubble

panelCollection

  • 10.1.3: decorateCollection
  • Current: panelCollection

panelForm

Component Name:

  • 10.1.3: panelForm
  • Current: panelFormLayout

Changed Attributes:

10.1.3 Current Notes
width inlineStyle or styleClass Obsolete. This attribute is no longer needed because width can be defined explicitly through the inlineStyle attribute or implicitly through the styleClass attribute.

panelGroupLayout

Component Name:

  • 10.1.3: panelGroup
  • Current: panelGroupLayout

panelHeader

Component Name:

  • 10.1.3: panelHeader
  • Current: panelHeader

Changed Attributes:

10.1.3 Current Notes

panelHorizontal see: panelGroupLayout

panelLabelAndMessage

Component Name:

  • 10.1.3: panelLabelAndMessage
  • Current: panelLabelAndMessage

Changed Attributes:

10.1.3 Current Notes
anchor (removed) Obsolete. This attribute was ignored in 10.1.3; it gathered this information from the 'for' attribute.
message (removed) Obsolete, use FacesMessage instead.
messageType (removed) Obsolete, use FacesMessage instead.
messageDescUrl (removed) Obsolete. See messaging framework documentation.
messageTargetFrame (removed) Obsolete. See messaging framework documentation.
tip (removed) use the new help facet - see below. To upgrade put an outputText in the new help facet and set the outputText's 'value' attribute to the old tip text.
valign labelStyle The valign attribute was not flexible enough so labelStyle was introduced. The labelStyle attribute specifies inline styles for the label portion of the component, e.g. "vertical-align: bottom;" to align the label to the bottom of the container.

Changed Facets:

10.1.3 Current Notes
(n/a) help information to help the user fill in a field

panelList

Component Name:

  • 10.1.3: panelList
  • Current: panelList

Changed Attributes:

10.1.3 Current Notes
(n/a) listStyle The styleClass and inlineStyle attributes are now rendered on the root dom element instead of the <ul> element as it was in 10.1.3. In 10.1.3 you could change the list style by setting the inlineStyle attribute, but now you need to set the listStyle attribute. For example, you can style the list to be squares like this: listStyle='list-style-type:square'

Additional Notes:

  • WARNING: This component's APIs and behavior could possibly change when the BLAF+ spec for this component has been finalized.

panelMenu see: menu

panelPage see:menuBar

panelPage see:pageTemplate

separator

  • Before JM5: objectSeparator
  • JM5 onwards: separator

Changed Attributes:

10.1.3 Current Notes
(none) inlineStyle this attribute was added
(none) styleClass this attribute was added

Additional Notes:

  • In the rich client, the objectSeperator was used to separate menu items. This is no longer the case. Please look at panelToobar for information on how to duplicate this functionality.

showDetail

Component Name:

  • 10.1.3: showDetail
  • Current: showDetail

Additional Notes:

  • Although the APIs for this component have not changed, the behavior has. In 10.1.3, if either the disclosedText OR the undisclosedText attribute was not specified, and the prompt facet was not specified, then the default "hide" or "show" text would be rendered in place of the missing attribute. In the current release, the default values are only displayed if NEITHER the disclosedText nor the undisclosedText is specified. If one of those attributes is specified the component will use the same label for both the disclosed state AND the undisclosed state. If both are specified, it will switch between them as normal. This was done to prevent the application developer from having to specify BOTH a disclosedText and an undisclosedText attribute in order to create a showDetail without a changing label and should help with BLAF+ usecases.

showDetailHeader

Component Name:

  • 10.1.3: showDetailHeader
  • Current: showDetailHeader

Changed Attributes:

10.1.3 Current Notes
shortText (removed) Obsolete, no replacement
size size Negative numbers imply automatic header level determination. Default has changed to -1.
(none) messageType Added messageType to showDetailHeader in order to maintain consistancy with panelHeader.

showDetailItem

Component Name:

  • 10.1.3: showDetailItem
  • Current: showDetailItem

Changed Attributes:

10.1.3 Current Notes
(none) flex A non-negative integer that indicates the flexibility of this component in its container. If the container supports it, flex is used to determine how space is distributed among its children. Components with larger flex values will be made larger than components with lower flex values. This is done so at the ratio determined by the flex of each of the two components. The actual value is only relevant if there are other flexible components (components with flex values larger than zero) within the same container.
(none) inflexibleHeight A non-zero integer that indicates the number of pixels tall the item is in its container when flex is set to zero. It is only used if its container supports it, e.g. a panelAccordion with discloseMany="true".

Changed Facets:

10.1.3 Current Notes
(none) toolbar This facet has been added to support BLAF+. The toolbar is not rendered as part of this component but can be rendered by a parent component (e.g. accordionPanel) when toolbar functionality is needed to comply with BLAF+. Please note that not all valid parent components will support toolbars.

Additional Notes:

  • The functionality added here is not rendered as part of this component. Rather, these items are to be consumed by a showOne or showMany component.

showOneAccordion see: panelAccordion

  • JM8 onwards:component removed

table

Component Name:

  • 10.1.3: table
  • Current: table

Changed Attributes:

10.1.3 Current Notes
rowSelection new attribute to control selection. use "single" for single selection. use "multiple" for multiple selection.
selectionState selectedRowKeys renamed.
banding rowBandingInterval or columnBandingInterval for row banding use nonzero value for rowBandingInterval. For column banding use nonzero value for columnBandingInterval. Use zero for both to turn off banding.
bandingInterval rowBandingInterval or columnBandingInterval renamed.
width inlineStyle removed. use inlineStyle attribute to set the width using css.

Changed Facets:

10.1.3 Current Notes
actions This facet was removed. The components in this facet should be moved to the "toolbar" facet on the new decorateCollection component.
selection This facet was removed. Selection is now controlled by the new "rowSelection" attribute. See the tableSelectOne and tableSelectMany components for more details.

Additional Notes:

  • todo

  • Current: component removed

Changed Attributes:

10.1.3 Current Notes

Changed Facets:

10.1.3 Current Notes

Additional Notes:

  • selection on the table is controlled by the "rowSelection" attribute on the table/treeTable component
  • move the children of this component into the "toolbar" facet of the surrounding "decorateCollection" component.
